meanings.definition: The act of dividing something again.
meanings.sent1: The redivision of the cake ensured everyone got a fair share.
meanings.sent2: After the redivision of tasks, the team worked more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The redivision of the toys among the children led to giggles and smiles.
meanings.sent4: The redivision of power in the kingdom caused quite a stir among the nobles.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes sparkled with excitement at the prospect of a redivision of the treasure.

meanings.definition: The result of dividing something again.
meanings.sent1: The redivision of the land left some farmers with smaller plots.
meanings.sent2: The redivision of the budget meant some departments received less funding.
meanings.sent3: The redivision of the cookies resulted in crumbs all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The redivision of responsibilities brought clarity to the team dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The redivision of the puzzle pieces revealed a hidden picture.
